title: How to see specific changes that another editor made in Google Docs - Quora

response.answer_text: If you open the document, then go to file and see revision history.http://docs.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=92199or herehttp://docs.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=190843 you might be able to obtain further detail through the Google Docs Api - but im not sure how extensive the reporting from there is. cheers Neil
The only way you really can tell if someone worked on it is if everyone uses a different color, then at the end change it all back to one color.

Neil is correct, all the details you need are in revision history. Each user is colour coded and the changes are highlighted.  However I believe this only works for documents that have been created since this feature was added to Google Apps, which has only been a month or 2.

The old version also had revision tracking. Where the confusion probably came from is that the new version didn't have revision tracking for a while, and then they announced it again so people may have assumed it was a brand new feature but it was just being reinstated.
